intro: Galium leucocarpum, commonly known as white-fruited bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and opposite, simple leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by distinctive white, fleshy fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium leucocarpum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
